newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Divided EU postpones statement on Iraq.
newsitem.headline: Divided EU postpones statement on Iraq.

text.p: The European Union has postponed issuing a joint statement on the U.S. attacks on Iraq, underlining the division in Europe over the American action, EU diplomats said on Wednesday.
They said Britain had pushed at a meeting of senior officials on Tuesday for a strong statement of support for the U.S. action but that others, notably France, had resisted.
"The British asked for a statement to be issued. France objected," one diplomat said.
France argued that such a statement should come from EU foreign ministers, due to meet in Ireland on Saturday and Sunday, rather than from the normal committee of political officials.
EU statements on matters of foreign policy are normally routine. They are supposed to reflect the 15-nation bloc's common foreign and security policy.

Diplomats said France, which has publicly distanced itself from the U.S. action, said it also favoured a statement focused on the need for civil rights and an end to fighting in Iraq rather than backing for Washington.
